meanings.definition: A mark or other indication of the existence or passing of something.
meanings.sent1: The detective followed the traces left by the thief.
meanings.sent2: The traces of footsteps in the snow led us to the lost dog.
meanings.sent3: The traces of chocolate on his face revealed who ate the cake.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter left traces of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The old map showed traces of ancient civilizations.

meanings.definition: A very small quantity or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: There were only traces of sugar left in the bowl.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for traces of salt to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent3: She found traces of paint on her clothes after the art class.
meanings.sent4: The traces of rain on the window indicated a passing storm.
meanings.sent5: The traces of sunlight peeked through the clouds.

meanings.definition: To find or discover by investigation.
meanings.sent1: The detective tried to traces the missing person's whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: She traces the source of the strange noise to the attic.
meanings.sent3: He traces his keys to the last place he remembered having them.
meanings.sent4: The scientist traced the origin of the virus to a contaminated sample.
meanings.sent5: The explorer traced the river back to its source in the mountains.
